info.title: Recipe - Food - Nutrition
info.description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.
info.x-long-description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale of the returned category, supported is en\_US and en\_GB.

post.description: Given a grocery product title, this endpoint allows you to detect what basic ingredient it is.

post.description: Map a set of ingredients to products you can buy in the grocery store.

parameters.description: The locale of the returned category, supported is en_US and en_GB.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return, between [1,100]

parameters.name: metaInformation
parameters.description: Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found ingredients must not cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. Possible values are: dairy, egg, gluten, peanut, sesame, seafood, shellfish, soy, sulfite, tree nut, and wheat.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query - a partial or full ingredient name.

get.description: Get information about a packaged food product.

parameters.name: includeNutrition
parameters.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information. Nutrition data is per serving. If you want the nutrition data for the entire recipe, just multiply by the number of servings.

parameters.description: The id of the recipe.

get.description: Find a set of recipes that adhere to the given nutrient limits. All the found recipes will have macro nutrients within the calories, protein, fat, and carbohydrate limits.

post.description: Create a recipe card given a recipe.

backgroundColor.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

fontColor.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

image.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

ingredients.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

instructions.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line.

mask.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

readyInMinutes.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

servings.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Results are in HTML.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Get a recipe's nutrition widget data.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The maximal number of recipes to return (default = 5).

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether to only show recipes with an attribution license.

parameters.name: ignorePantry
parameters.description: Whether to ignore pantry ingredients such as water, salt, flour etc..

parameters.name: ranking
parameters.description: Whether to maximize used ingredients (1) or minimize missing ingredients (2) first.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that the recipes should contain.

get.description: Find recipes that use as many of the given ingredients as possible and have as little as possible missing ingredients. This is a whats in your fridge API endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Get a recipe's ingredient list.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. Possible values are: pescetarian, lacto vegetarian, ovo vegetarian, vegan, and vegetarian.

parameters.name: excludeIngredients
parameters.description: An comma-separated list of ingredients or ingredient types that must not be contained in the recipes.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found recipes must not have ingredients that could cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. Possible values are: dairy, egg, gluten, peanut, sesame, seafood, shellfish, soy, sulfite, tree nut, and wheat.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return (between 0 and 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 900).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the recipes. One of the following: main course, side dish, dessert, appetizer, salad, bread, breakfast, soup, beverage, sauce, or drink.

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

parameters.name: instructionsRequired
parameters.description: Whether the recipes must have instructions.

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more (comma separated) of the following: african, chinese, japanese, korean, vietnamese, thai, indian, british, irish, french, italian, mexican, spanish, middle eastern, jewish, american, cajun, southern, greek, german, nordic, eastern european, caribbean, or latin american.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The (natural language) recipe search query.

get.description: Search recipes in natural language.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

parameters.description: What is the caloric target for one day? The meal plan generator will try to get as close as possible to that goal.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: Enter a diet that the meal plan has to adhere to, e.g. "vegetarian", "vegan", "paleo" etc.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of allergens or ingredients that must be excluded.

parameters.description: The recipe id.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Results are in HTML.

get.description: Visualize a recipe's ingredient list.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 25.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The (partial) search query.

get.description: Generate suggestions for grocery products based on a (partial) query. The matches will be found by looking in the title only.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 25.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The (partial) search query.

get.description: Generate suggestions for menu items based on a (partial) query. The matches will be found by looking in the title only.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The nutrition-related question.

schema.example: How much vitamin c is in 2 apples?

get.description: Answer a nutrition related natural language question.

parameters.name: maxPrice
parameters.description: The maximum price of the recommended wine.

parameters.name: minRating
parameters.description: The minimum rating of the recommended wine between 0 and 1. For example, 0.8 equals 4 out of 5 stars.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of wine recommendations expected.

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine to get a specific product recommendation for.

get.description: Get a specific wine recommendation (concrete product) for a given wine, e.g. "merlot".

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine, e.g. "malbec", "riesling", or "merlot".

get.description: Get the description of a certain wine, e.g. "malbec", "riesling", or "merlot".

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine that should be paired, e.g. "merlot", "riesling", or "malbec".

get.description: Get a dish that goes well with a given wine.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the dish.

get.description: Guess the macro nutrients of a dish given its title.

parameters.name: maxPrice
parameters.description: The maximum price for the specific wine recommendation.

parameters.name: food
parameters.description: The food to get a pairing for. This can be a dish ("steak"), an ingredient ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").

get.description: Find a wine that goes well with a food. Food can be a dish name ("steak"), an ingredient name ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").

parameters.name: upc
parameters.description: The UPC code of the product for that you want to find comparable products.

get.description: Find comparable products to the given one.

parameters.description: Results are in HTML.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Results are in HTML.

get.description: Visualize a grocery product's nutritional information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the recipe, e.g. one of the following: main course, side dish, dessert, appetizer, salad, bread, breakfast, soup, beverage, sauce, or drink.

parameters.name: minLength
parameters.description: Minimum video length in seconds.

parameters.name: maxLength
parameters.description: Maximum video length in seconds.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results [1,100].

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine of the videos, e.g. one of the following: african, chinese, japanese, korean, vietnamese, thai, indian, british, irish, french, italian, mexican, spanish, middle eastern, jewish, american, cajun, southern, greek, german, nordic, eastern european, caribbean, latin american

parameters.name: includeingredients
parameters.description: Ingredients the recipe videos must contain.

parameters.name: excludeingredients
parameters.description: Ingredients the recipe videos must not contain.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset in the result set [0,900].

get.description: Find recipe and other food related videos.

parameters.name: includeNutrition
parameters.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of recipe ids.

get.description: Get information about multiple recipes at once. That is equivalent of calling the Get Recipe Information endpoint multiple times but is faster. Note that each returned recipe counts as one request.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of that food.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit for the given amount.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the food (ingredient).

get.description: Get information about a certain food (ingredient).

parameters.name: sourceUnit
parameters.description: The unit from which you want to convert, e.g. the cups in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "serving" or "piece".

parameters.name: sourceAmount
parameters.description: The amount from which you want to convert, e.g. the 2.5 in "2.5 cups of flour to grams"

parameters.name: ingredientName
parameters.description: The ingredient which you want to convert, e.g. the flour in "2.5 cups of flour to grams"

parameters.name: targetUnit
parameters.description: The unit to which you want to convert, e.g. the grams in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "piece", e.g. "3.4 oz tomatoes to piece"

get.description: Convert amounts like "2 cups of flour to grams".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the ingredient you want substitutes for.

get.description: Search for substitutes for a given ingredient.

parameters.name: ingredientName
parameters.description: The name of the ingredient you want to replace.

get.description: Get ingredient substitutes by ingredient name.
Returns random food trivia.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of suggestions to return must be in interval [1,25].

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A (partial) query from the user. The endpoint will return if it matches topics it can talk about.

get.description: This endpoint returns suggestions for things the user can say or ask the chat bot.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: An arbitrary globally unique id for your conversation. The conversation can contain states so you should pass your context id if you want the bot to be able to remember the conversation.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The request/question/answer from the user to the chat bot.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to have a conversation about food with the spoonacular chat bot. Use the chat suggests endpoint to show your user what he or she can say.
Get a random joke that includes or is about food.
Get information about a food product given its UPC.

post.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

text.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
text.example: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results between [1,25].

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to be autocompleted.

get.description: Autocomplete a partial input to possible recipe names.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of random recipes to be returned. Must be in interval [1,100]. NOTE: Each random recipe returned counts as one request.

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags that the random recipe(s) must adhere to.

get.description: Find random (popular) recipes.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to search for. You can also use partial queries such as "spagh" to already find spaghetti recipes, articles, grocery products, and other content.

get.description: Search spoonacular's site content. You'll be able to find everything that you could also find using the search suggests on spoonacular.com. This is a suggest API so you can send partial strings as queries.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Results are in HTML.

post.description: Visualize the equipment used to make a recipe.

view.description: Either "grid" or "list" as visualization of the equipment.

defaultCss.description: Whether the the default CSS should be returned.

showBacklink.description: If you show the backlink to spoonacular, the request will be free.

instructions.example: Use a blender for the nuts and put them in the pan.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The recipe search query.

schema.example: salmon with fusilli and no nuts

get.description: Parse a recipe search query to find out its intention.

parameters.name: stepBreakdown
parameters.description: Whether to break down the recipe steps even more.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the recipe.

get.description: Get an analyzed breakdown of a recipe's instructions. Each step is enriched with the ingredients and the equipment that is used.

post.description: Extract ingredients and equipment from the recipe instruction steps.

instructions.example: Put the garlic in a pan and then add the onion.

parameters.name: minIron
parameters.description: The minimum number of milligrams of iron the recipe must have.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found recipes must not have ingredients that could cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. Possible values are: dairy, egg, gluten, peanut, sesame, seafood, shellfish, soy, sulfite, tree nut, and wheat.

parameters.name: maxVitaminB5
parameters.description: The maximum number of milligrams of Vitamin B5 the recipe can have.

parameters.name: minFolicAcid
parameters.description: The minimum number of micrograms of folic acid the recipe must have.

parameters.name: minVitaminA
parameters.description: The minimum number of IU of Vitamin A the recipe must have.

parameters.description: The maximum number of milligrams of sodium the recipe can have.

parameters.name: maxSugar
parameters.description: The maximum number of grams of sugar the recipe can have.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. Possible values are: pescetarian, lacto vegetarian, ovo vegetarian, vegan, paleo, primal, and vegetarian.

parameters.name: maxVitaminA
parameters.description: The maximum number of IU of Vitamin A the recipe can have.

parameters.name: maxFluoride

parameters.name: minCholine
parameters.description: The minimum number of milligrams of choline the recipe must have.

parameters.name: ranking
parameters.description: Whether to minimize missing ingredients (0), maximize used ingredients (1) first, or rank recipes by relevance (2).
